path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Verichains_Lab/Verichains Public Audit Report - CyberEight Smartcontracts - v1.3.pdf

findings.title: Wrong formula for depositAmounts
findings.description: In the addVestingInformationMultiple function of the Vesting contract, the depositAmounts variable is miscalculated.

findings.title: Contract blocking in buyGachaBox can be circumvented
findings.description: The requirement checking if the caller is a contract can be bypassed by calling from a constructing contract (calling from the constructor function)

findings.title: Unsafe random function
findings.description: The _random function uses a predictable seed generated from block properties, which can lead to unsafe randomness.

findings.title: Missing startTime check in buyGachaBox
findings.description: In the buyGachaBox function, when a user buys a gacha box, the block.timestamp is checked to ensure it's not greater than gachaEvent.endTime. However, the gachaEvent.startTime is not checked here.

findings.title: durationTime must be divisible by periodTime
findings.description: When adding a new vesting by using addVestingInformation function, the vesting.durationTime should be divisible by vesting.periodTime. If this condition is not met, the vestingCount_ will be round down so that the value of vesting.periodVestingAmount will be higher than it should be.

findings.title: Storage data of the token should be deleted when burning
findings.description: In the Cue and Box contracts, storage data attached to a token's id is not deleted when the token is burnt.

findings.title: Wrong index upper bound check in array
findings.description: The remove functions in the ArrayLib contract have an off-by-one bug in their upper bound index checks.

findings.title: Wrong function name getVestingParticipants
findings.description: The name of the getVestingParticipants function of the Vesting contract is wrong and misleading.

findings.title: availableAmount should only be calculated when the vesting is claimable
findings.description: In the _claim function of the Vesting contract, the statement which calculates the availableAmount should not be run if the vesting is not claimable.
